availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Alfred Evans (Jackson County, Kentucky, tavern keeper and soldier - Pvt. 13th Ky. Cav. )

body.p: Jackson County, Kentucky, tavern keeper and soldier. Kentucky. Tennessee native. Son of William Evans and Mary Evans. Married to Rebecca Baker Evans in Owsley County, Kentucky, on July 12, 1854. Father of James Evans, Mary Evans, and George Evans. Laborer in Claiborne County, Tennessee, in 1850. Attended school in Claiborne County in 1850. Tavern keeper in Jackson County, Kentucky, in 1860. Employed Jane Gabbert as a domestic worker in Jackson County in 1860. Served in the Thirteenth Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as a private from August 1863 to January 29, 1865. Captured in Lee County, Virginia on November 12, 1863. Imprisoned at Camp Chase, Cincinnati, Ohio, from November 23, 1863 to January 20, 1865. Signed a loyalty oath to the U. S. government on January 29, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Tennessee, Claiborne County, District 7, p. 246B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jackson County, McKee, p. 914.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Owsley County, Island Creek, p. 334B.
“Evans, Alfred,” Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers Who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0066.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994052, Owsley County Marriages.
